title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Designation of military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and Secretary of Commerce respectively. The designated zones and areas include the local communities within the jurisdiction of the military installations. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and Secretary of Commerce designate military installations for closure or realignment as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas within 60 days of recommendation in a base closure report. The designated zones and areas include the local communities within the jurisdiction of the military installations. The Act requires the designation of enterprise zones and redevelopment areas for military installations within 60 days of closure or realignment recommendations. Designated zones are in addition to existing enterprise zones, and funding for economic adjustment may come from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce. Redevelopment area designation remains in effect for 5 years. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area remains in effect for 5 years. The Secretary of Commerce conducts annual reviews and may terminate or modify the designation if it does not meet requirements. Definitions include "base closure law" and "substantial realignment." The term "substantial realignment" in the Amendments and Base Closure and Realignment Act refers to a significant reduction in military installation operations where 50% or more of personnel are reassigned to another location. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. Section 501(a) of the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of buildings on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas for homeless assistance until certain certifications are met.
